definition[0]: to become ill again after you have seemed to improve
example[0]: We were afraid he might relapse into a coma.
definition[1]: to start to behave badly again
example[1]: Clara soon relapsed into her old ways.
definition[2]: when someone becomes ill again after having seemed to improve
example[2]: She had a relapse and died soon after.
definition[3]: to start to get worse again after things had seemed to improve
example[3]: The U.S., after a brief recovery mid-year, is relapsing into a second slump.
